Class AbstractLightEnergyLink

java.lang.Object
net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.CapabilityProvider<net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity>
net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity
etithespirit.orimod.common.tile.light.AbstractLightEnergyLink
All Implemented Interfaces:
IWorldUpdateListener, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilityProvider, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilityProviderImpl<net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity>, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilitySerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag>, net.minecraftforge.common.extensions.IForgeBlockEntity, net.minecraftforge.common.util.INBTSerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.CompoundTag>
Direct Known Subclasses:
TileEntityLightEnergyConduit
public abstract class AbstractLightEnergyLink extends net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity implements IWorldUpdateListener
A counterpart to AbstractLightEnergyHub which represents a BlockEntity that links two or more AbstractLightEnergyHubs together. These form the fundamental components of a Line.

      Parameters:
      type - The block entity type.
      at - The location to create it at.
      state - The BlockState to create it for.

    • getAssemblyLine

      @Nullable public Line getAssemblyLine()
      Returns:

    • neighborAddedOrRemoved

      public void neighborAddedOrRemoved(net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.BlockState state, net.minecraft.world.level.Level world, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos at, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos changedAt, net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity replacedTile, boolean isMoving)
      Description copied from interface: IWorldUpdateListener
      Occurs when a IWorldUpdateListener adjacent to this BlockEntity is added, replaced, or removed.
      Specified by:
      neighborAddedOrRemoved in interface IWorldUpdateListener
      Parameters:
      state - The state of this block.
      world - The world this change occurred in.
      at - Where in the world this change occurred.
      changedAt - Where the change occurred.
      replacedTile - The previous TileEntity at the block. It will be missing core data, so reference the world and changedAt parameters to get the world and location.
      isMoving - Whether or not this change occurred due to a piston push.
